oai_dc:dc.dc:title: PHYSICAL MODELLING FOR THE PRINCESS ELISABETH ISLAND, OVERTOPPING DESIGN FOR A CAISSON WITH A DOUBLE WAVE WALL GEOMETRY
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Doorslaer, Koen Van
Vasarmidis, Panagiotis
Schepens, Koen
Olst, Bart van
Koelen, Luc van
Bijl, Eelco
Weygers, Michiel
Guillermin, Pierre-Yves
Streicher, Maximilian
Dixen, Martin
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: For the design of the worldâ€™s first offshore energy island, consisting of vertical caisson breakwaters with a double row of wave walls to prevent the land area from severe wave overtopping, intense physical modelling has been carried out in 2D wave flumes and a large 3D wave basin. Some lessons learned throughout the detailed design will be presented, with a focus on wave overtopping. Rockwork stability and wave impact forces also have been measured but are not the focus of this abstract.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 38 (2024): Proceedings of 38th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Rome, Italy, 2024; structures.108
